panels.description:
Load average represents the average number of running and un-interruptable processes residing in the kernel's execution queue. 

Typically, short term, midterm, and long term series give running averages of 1m, 5m, and 15m, respectively.
panels.title: Load Average

panels.description: Average non-idle CPU activity of all cores on node
panels.title: Aggr. Usage

panels.description: Shows average time spent for each activity across all cores

targets.expr: sum(collectd_cpu_percent{type_instance!="idle", host="$hosts", service=~".+-$clouds-.+"}) by (type_instance) / count(collectd_cpu_percent{host="$hosts", service=~".+-$clouds-.+"}) by (type_instance)

panels.title: Aggr. Usage by Type

targets.expr: sum by (plugin_instance) (collectd_df_df_inodes{type_instance="used", host="$hosts", service=~".+-$clouds-.+"}) / sum by (plugin_instance) (collectd_df_df_inodes{host="$hosts", service=~".+-$clouds-.+"})

panels.description:
Approximate percentage of total disk bandwidth being used.

Weighted I/O includes the backlog that may be accumulating.
panels.title: Load

panels.description: Average time each I/O operation took to complete. Per the collectd disk plugin docs (https://collectd.org/wiki/index.php/Plugin:Disk), this average is not very accurate.
panels.title: Avg. I/O Operation Time
